meanings.definition: A man trained in arms and horsemanship.
meanings.sent1: The cavaleros showed great skill in handling weapons and riding horses.
meanings.sent2: The village celebrated the arrival of the cavaleros, skilled in both combat and horsemanship.
meanings.sent3: The cavaleros impressed the crowd with their swordsmanship and equestrian abilities.
meanings.sent4: In the battlefield, the cavaleros were like swift-moving shadows, striking fear into their enemies.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cavaleros riding into battle stayed etched in the minds of all who witnessed it.

meanings.sent1: The king's loyal cavaleros rode into battle with bravery and honor.
meanings.sent2: In the medieval tales, the cavaleros were often depicted as noble warriors on horseback.
meanings.sent3: The cavaleros' armor clanked loudly as they rode through the castle gates, announcing their arrival.
meanings.sent4: The cavaleros' steeds galloped like thunder, carrying them swiftly towards the enemy lines.
meanings.sent5: Legends spoke of the cavaleros' chivalry and valor in protecting the kingdom.

meanings.sent1: The young cavaleros at the ball danced gracefully with the ladies, charming everyone with their manners.
meanings.sent2: The cavaleros in their fine attire exuded an air of sophistication and elegance.
meanings.sent3: The cavaleros' polite gestures and courteous behavior won the admiration of all the guests.
meanings.sent4: Among the nobles, he was known as the cavaleros with the most refined etiquette and gallantry.
meanings.sent5: The cavaleros' presence at the royal court added a touch of class and charm to the evening.
